main event: On August 22, 1953, at Barksdale A.F.B. in Louisiana, military personnel observed a flying object that appeared like a falling or exploding meteor or missile for less than 1 minute.
interesting points: The object was observed for less than 1 minute and had the appearance and movements of a falling or exploding meteor or missile.
There was only a very slight breeze blowing at the time, ruling out the possibility of the object being a balloon.
Multiple sightings of an unidentified object moving rapidly and leaving a streak in the sky were reported in the same area on different occasions.
A Major studying astronomy and a base game warden at the Barksdale Reservation both observed and reported the sighting.
The weather at the time of the sighting was described as very clear and cloudless, with a sky full of stars but no moon.
result: prosaic explanation - falling or exploding meteor or missile
sighted object: flying object with the appearance of a falling or exploding meteor or missile
witnesses: Military personnel, Major, and base game warden
